net.hudup.core.logistic

Class UriAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.logistic.UriAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, UriAssoc

    public class UriAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements UriAssoc, AutoCloseable
    This class is also a URI associator because it implements the interface UriAssoc but it hides all physical systems and protocols (file system, compressed file, HTTP, database, etc.). Actually, programmers should use this class for processing (creating, copying, renaming, deleting, getting reader, getting writer, etc.) on objects identified by URI, instead of implementing UriAssoc. UriAdapter is the most complete URI associator and it can use other URI associators for different physical systems and protocols. Concretely, the internal variable assoc refers to other URI associators. As a convention, UriAdapter is also called URI adapter.
    Version:
    11.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  UriAdapter.AdapterReader
      This class is the Reader (for reading operations on archives identified by URI) with support of URI adapter UriAdapter.
      static class  UriAdapter.AdapterWriteChannel
      This class is the ByteChannel (for both writing and reading operations on archives identified by URI) with support of URI adapter UriAdapter.
      static class  UriAdapter.AdapterWriter
      This class is the Writer (for writing operations on archives identified by URI) with support of URI adapter UriAdapter.

      • chooseUri

        public xURI chooseUri(java.awt.Component comp,
                      boolean open,
                      java.lang.String[] exts,
                      java.lang.String[] descs,
                      xURI curStore,
                      java.lang.String defaultExt)
        Description copied from interface: UriAssoc
        This method shows a graphic user interface (GUI) allowing users to select object (archive-file, store-directory) they want. Such GUI is called choice dialog. Such chosen object is returned by its referred URI.
        Specified by:
        chooseUri in interface UriAssoc
        Parameters:
        comp - The graphic user interface (GUI) component works as a parent component of choice dialog.
        open - If true then, choice dialog is open dialog allowing users to choose and open files. Otherwise, choice dialog is save dialog allowing users to choose and save objects.
        exts - The specified array of archive (file) extensions which are used to filter objects that users select, for example, "*.hdp", "*.xls". Each extension has a description. The respective array of extension descriptions is specified by the parameter descs. This parameter can be null.
        descs - The specified array of descriptions, for example, "Hudup file", "Excel 97-2003". Note that each extension has a description and the respective array of file extensions is represented by the parameter exts. This parameter can be null.
        curStore - Current store (directory) to open choice dialog. Current store can be null.
        defaultExt - default extension can be null.
        Returns:
        URI represented by xURI of chosen object.

      • chooseDefaultUri

        public xURI chooseDefaultUri(java.awt.Component comp,
                             boolean open,
                             xURI curStore)
        Description copied from interface: UriAssoc
        This method is similar to the method UriAssoc.chooseUri(Component, boolean, String[], String[], xURI, String) when it also allows users to select object except that it only lists default objects for choice. In current implementation, defaults objects are archives (files) having extensions: "*.*" (all files), "*.hdp" (Hudup files), and "*.xls" (97-2003 Excel files).
        Specified by:
        chooseDefaultUri in interface UriAssoc
        Parameters:
        comp - The graphic user interface (GUI) component works as a parent component of choice dialog.
        open - If true then, choice dialog is open dialog allowing users to choose and open files. Otherwise, choice dialog is save dialog allowing users to choose and save objects.
        curStore - Current store (directory) to open choice dialog. Current store can be null.
        Returns:
        URI represented by xURI of chosen object.

      • chooseStore

        public xURI chooseStore(java.awt.Component comp)
        Description copied from interface: UriAssoc
        This method shows choice dialog allowing users to select only store (directory).
        Specified by:
        chooseStore in interface UriAssoc
        Parameters:
        comp - The graphic user interface (GUI) component works as a parent component of choice dialog.
        Returns:
        URI represented by xURI of chosen store (directory).

      • makeFlatDataConfig

        public DataConfig makeFlatDataConfig(xURI unitUri,
                                     java.lang.String mainUnit)
        This method creates a configuration represented by DataConfig with full of units (user profile, item profile, rating matrix, etc.) from the URI of the unit in the configuration.
        Parameters:
        unitUri - URI of the specified unit in configuration.
        mainUnit - main unit. It can be null.
        Returns:
        configuration represented by DataConfig with full of units (user profile, item profile, rating matrix, etc.).

      • uriListProcess

        public void uriListProcess(xURI store,
                           UriFilter filter,
                           UriProcessor processor)
        Firstly, this method retrieves a list of URI (s) referring objects inside the specified store with regard to specified filter. For each retrieved URI, some task is processed on the object referred by such URI and so the specified UriProcessor is responsible for doing such task.
        Parameters:
        store - URI of specified store.
        filter - Specified filter represented by UriFilter.
        processor - Specified UriProcessor is responsible for doing such task on the object referred by each retrieved URI.

        Reading text from the archive (file) identified by URI by optimal way.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of specified archive (file).
        Returns:
        StringBuffer containing text from specified archive (file).

      • readLines

        public java.util.List<java.lang.StringBuffer> readLines(xURI uri)
        Reading text from the archive (file) in line-by-line manner.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of specified archive (file).
        Returns:
        List of text lines.

      • saveText

        public boolean saveText(xURI uri,
                        java.lang.String content,
                        boolean append)
        Saving (writing) text to the archive (file) identified by URI by optimal way.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of specified archive (file).
        content - Text content to saved to the specified archive (file).
        append - Whether or not "append" mode is applied for writing. In "append" mode, content is added continuously to the end of the archive (file). Otherwise, the archive (file) is made empty and then content is put into the archive (file) from beginning.
        Returns:
        whether save successfully

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: AutoCloseable
        The main method of this interface, which is responsible for releasing resources occupied by auto-closable object. The finalize() method of auto-closable class should call AutoCloseable.close() method so that AutoCloseable.close() method is called automatically before the Java garbage collector destroys auto-closable object.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • packageSlashToDot

        public static java.lang.String packageSlashToDot(java.lang.String slashPackage)
        Given slash package "java/lang/annotation" or "java\lang\annotation", this method converts such slash package into normal dot package "java.lang.annotation".
        Parameters:
        slashPackage - Specified slash package, for example, "java/lang/annotation", "java\lang\annotation".
        Returns:
        Dot package, for example, "java.lang.annotation".
